content: the tuffy boot sock i adore briggs & little tuffy sock yarn it s thick and warm and wears like iron it s not the softest yarn in my sock drawer but it stands up incredibly well for wearing in my winter boots http //www briggsandlittle com written for dpns magic loop or two circs use whichever you prefer sizes women s s shoe size 5-7 women s m shoe size 7½-9 women s l shoe size 9½+ men s s shoe size 6-9 men s l shoe size 9½+ materials 1 1 2 2 2 skeins briggs & little tuffy 80% wool 20% nylon 215yds/113gm skein sample uses colour oxford 1 set 3 75mm needles for working in the round dpns two circulars or a long circular as you prefer stitch markers 1 stitch holder optional gauge 20 sts and 28 rounds over 4 inches/10 cm square in stocking stitch using 3 75mm needles note stitch gauge is important round gauge less so this fabric is tight but it will be warmer and wear longer method cuff & leg using the long-tail method cast 36 40 42 46 48 stitches onto a single needle if you re working on dpns distribute stitches evenly across 3 needles if you re working on two circulars or magic loop divide them half and half join for working in the round being careful not to twist ribbing round *k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round repeat this round until sock measures 5cm/2 inches from cast-on next round knit all sts repeat this round until sock measures 17 18 20 20 20 cm/6 5 7 8 8 8 inches from cast-on edge turn heel this portion is knitted flat heel row 1 rs knit first 18 20 21 23 24 stitches onto one needle and turn so that ws is facing put remaining 18 20 21 23 24 stitches onto a holder or group them together on one needle heel row 2 ws slip 1 p17 19 20 22 23 turn heel row 3 rs slip 1 k17 19 20 22 23 turn heel row 4 ws slip 1 p17 19 20 22 23 turn repeat the last 2 row 6 7 7 8 9 more times rs is facing for next row heel turn row 1 rs k12 13 14 15 16 skp turn heel turn row 2 ws slip 1 p6 6 7 7 8 p2tog turn heel turn row 3 rs slip 1 k6 6 7 7 8 skp turn heel turn row 4 ws slip 1 p6 6 7 7 8 stitches p2tog turn repeat last two row until all stitches have been worked ensure rs is facing for next row 8 8 9 9 10 stitches remain on the needle re-establish round and create gusset knit the 8 8 9 9 10 heel stitches using that same needle pick up and knit 9 10 11 12 13 stitches along selvedge edge at side of heel using slipped
